H0.text: What separates East and West Malaysia. Strait of Malacca

H1.text: What separates East and West Malaysia. Sulu Sea

H2.text: What separates East and West Malaysia. Java Sea

H3.text: What separates East and West Malaysia. 南支那海

A4.text: The Strait of Malacca lies between the Malay Peninsula and the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

A5.text: The Strait of Malacca, lying between Sumatra and Peninsular Malaysia, is one of the most important thoroughfares in global commerce, carrying 40% of the world's trade.

A6.text: The two are separated by the South China Sea.

A7.text: To the east, across the South China Sea, lie the Natuna Islands, both part of Indonesia.

A8.text: The island today is surrounded by the South China Sea to the north and northwest.
